ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Shows how to use chart printing option and export to XPS and PNG
ExampleDefinition.Description:
SciChart supports [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Screenshots,_Printing_and_Export_to_XPS.html']exporting the chart[/url], including legends, series and annotations to various image formats, including export to [b]BitmapSource[/b] (in-memory bitmap), to Png, Jpg or Bmp file, to [b]XPS[/b] (scalable vector format) or printing to local printer.
[b]Export Scalable Vectors[/b]
To export a scalable vector such as XPS, you will need to enable the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Drawing~SciChart.Drawing.XamlRasterizer.XamlRenderSurface.html']XamlRenderSurface[/url].
There is a code sample [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Renderer_Plugins.html']how to enable the XamlRenderSurface here[/url].
Be sure to re-enable the old RenderSurface after export as the XamlRenderSurface is slower and is not suitable for real-time drawing.
